page.title: 01LOCHGOILHEAD-A SUMMARY
page.content: Lochgoilhead is a small village in Argyll about 60km WNW of Glasgow.It is situated at the head of Loch Goil,a sea loch.In winter the loch often lives up to its Gaelic name,which means{stormy.}The houses are built on the narrow ribbon of flat land along the shores. The hills around the village are high, rugged and steep;some of them reaching over 700m.Much of the hills is covered with conifer plantations but some natural woodland remains.The hills drop steeply to the loch which is narrow and deep. The routes into the village by road either through{Hells Glen(B 839)}or{ {Glen Mor(B 828).}The roads,which are single track,twist and turn their ways through the glens.Despite this the village is popular with tourists.
